title: Ethereum Resumes Finalizing Blocks after Second Performance Hiccup in 24 Hours - CoinDesk
summary: Ethereum experienced a second performance hiccup in 24 hours, causing blocks to not finalize. This raised security concerns for users, as transactions may be re-ordered or dropped from the network. The cause of the incident is unknown.

title: Ethereum Finality Hiccup a 'Fire Drill' That 'Could Have Been Avoided' - Blockworks
summary: Ethereum suffered a "fire drill" hiccup on Thursday that could have been avoided if less than a third of validators ran the same consensus layer software client. The issue caused a failure to finalize blocks, but end users didn't notice much of an effect due to continuous transaction processing. The cause is still unknown, but it involved a coincidence of "two or three issues." The problem resurfaced on Friday, but was resolved after a restart. The incident highlights the importance of client diversity in preventing network halts and ensuring resilience.

title: Ethereum Network Suffers Finality Issues—Here's What That Means - Yahoo Finance
summary: Ethereum, the second largest blockchain, experienced a technical issue on Friday, causing its network to halt finalizing blocks for over an hour. Finality takes roughly 15 minutes and refers to the guarantee that a block cannot be altered or removed from the blockchain without burning at least 33% of the total staked ETH. The cause of the outage is still unclear, but prominent venture capitalist Adam Cochran tweeted that it is a "liveness fault" and hopes it is an implementation issue that can be fixed. However, Ethereum core developer Eric Conner said on Twitter that there was a bug in some clients that has already been fixed. Despite the controversy, the network is now up and running again at full capacity, with blocks being finalized.

title: Ethereum's beacon chain suffers another finality issue - The Block
summary: Ethereum's Beacon chain experienced another finality issue, causing transactions to not be fully processed for an hour on Friday. This is the second such issue in as many days, raising concerns about the stability of the network. Data sources showed a significant reduction in attestations received during affected epochs, and some believe the issue may be due to bugs in staking clients or MEV infrastructures. Despite the outage, Ethereum did not go down, and transactions could still be processed during the affected epochs.

title: Ethereum Network Suffers Finality Issues—Here’s What That Means - Decrypt
summary: Ethereum, the second largest blockchain by market cap, experienced a technical issue that caused its network to halt finalizing blocks for over an hour. Finality takes roughly 15 minutes and refers to the guarantee that a block cannot be altered or removed from the blockchain without burning 33% of the total staked ETH. The cause of the outage is still unclear, but prominent venture capitalist Adam Cochran tweeted that it's either an implementation issue or a larger protocol issue. However, Ethereum core developer Eric Conner said that the network did not go down but rather had a bug in some clients that has already been fixed. Despite the controversy, the network is now up and running again at full capacity.

title: Ethereum Stopped Finalizing Transactions for 25 Minutes - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Ethereum experienced a 25-minute disruption in finalizing transactions due to an unidentified issue. Core developers are investigating the cause but have restored finality. The issue seemed to fix itself without intervention. Developers are looking to improve state caching to prevent similar disruptions in the future. The incident was described as a "great firedrill" and a reminder of the network's resilience.

title: Ethereum Gas Fees Fall to Lowest Level in Two Years - The Defiant - DeFi News
summary: Ethereum gas fees have reached their lowest level in two years, with transactions executing for less than 13 gwei. This sharp decline in network activity may cast doubt on the bullish signal of The Merge, which is expected to make Ethereum deflationary by destroying more Ether than is created as validator rewards. However, the current burn rate would only offset two-thirds of Ether issuance after The Merge, according to Justin Drake, a researcher at the Ethereum Foundation. Despite this, Ethereum has already produced 26 days of deflationary issuance since transaction fee burning was introduced.

title: Imprisoned Ethereum Developer Virgil Griffith Faces 10-year Export Privilege Bar - Blockworks
summary: Imprisoned Ethereum developer Virgil Griffith faces 10-year export privilege bar. Griffith, who is serving 5 years in prison, may not participate in any export-related transactions upon release. The order is effective until April 2032. Griffith was sentenced to 63 months and fined $100,000 last year after pleading guilty to conspiracy to violate the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. In 2018, Griffith developed cryptocurrency infrastructure for North Korea, which could bypass US sanctions.

title: Cardano's hydra scaling solution goes live on mainnet as Ethereum gas fees surge - CryptoSlate
summary:

However, Cardano's token ADA has not seen a significant value increase despite these developments. Meanwhile, Ethereum gas fees have surged due to the recent meme coin frenzy, posing an obstacle to mass adoption.

title: EDCON Montenegro: Speakers and full agenda unveiled - Cointelegraph
summary: EDCON Montenegro 2023 has announced its full agenda and speaker list, featuring prominent figures in the blockchain and Ethereum communities. The event will take place in Podgorica, Montenegro from May 19-23 and will include a Super Demo day, main conference, and community event day. Speakers will cover topics such as zero knowledge and privacy, decentralized governance, and public goods. Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, will share his insights on the current state of Ethereum. Other notable speakers include Tim Beiko, Skylar Weaver, Barry Whitehat, Cy Li, Eli Ben-Sasson, Sergey Nazarov, and Scott Moore. The event aims to drive progress in the blockchain industry and showcase projects from the global Ethereum community. For more information and ticket purchase, visit the conference website.

The stake effectiveness metric has also improved, indicating a transfer of validator rewards to the Ethereum Mainnet. However, the prediction depends on the participation rate, and it remains to be seen if demand will reach the predicted levels.

title: ETH Holdings on Exchanges Hit All-Time Low Despite Recent ETH Slump - DailyCoin
summary: Ethereum investors are moving their assets from centralized exchanges to self-custody wallets at an all-time high. Despite a recent slump in price, the percentage of ETH held on exchanges has reached a low of 10.1%, the lowest since public trading began in 2015. This trend towards self-custody highlights the importance of security and control over assets, especially in light of recent events such as the FTX blowup. Meanwhile, ETH has gone down in the past week, but remains deflationary and with a market cap of $214 billion.

title: Ethereum Miner Revenue Outpaces Bitcoin In 2021 - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum miner revenue has outpaced Bitcoin's in 2021, with ETH miners seeing higher returns on their activity. The difference in revenue figures is due to several factors, including higher volatility in ETH and higher fees on the network. The London hard fork has also contributed to the increased scarcity of ETH, leading to higher revenues for miners. Despite the Chinese government's crackdown on crypto mining, ETH miners were less affected and saw better returns than BTC miners. The growing popularity of DeFi and NFTs has also driven up fees on the ETH network, benefiting miners. Overall, ETH mining revenue has been higher than BTC mining revenue in 2021.

title: Binance: big news on BETH crypto - The Cryptonomist
summary: Binance has announced that it will reduce the wait time for users to redeem their BETH crypto, which is a liquid version of Ethereum staked on the Beacon chain, from 15 days to 5 days. This is great news for users who want to redeem their staked ETH but have been waiting for a long time. The reduction in wait time is due to Binance's commitment to providing the best end-user experience and is based on the fact that new validator activations far outnumber exit requests. The number of locked coins within the Beacon chain has reached a new all-time high, easing selling pressure in the markets and creating scarcity. Additionally, the crypto BETH is one of the liquid versions in circulation to support the staking of ETH and the transition from POW to POS. Lido, the largest liquid wagering platform on the market, will allow the release of 270,000 ETHs on May 15, which will likely be poured into the cryptocurrency markets, causing volatility.
